rename.to: mjpeg codec glitching out on Linux

body: What is the camera manufacturer and model?

> What is the camera manufacturer and model?

I edited it with more information, figured the only way I'll get any help or anything is if I don't add something everyday. From now on, I'll add anything requested and anything I think anyone helping me will need. I sincerely apologize, for kind of being a bit spammy
Every Avenue I've gone down to try and fix this. All dead ends, not sure what to do now. If anyone is interested, just ask me for anything you need, and hopefully come up with a solution.

I've basically worked around this by using a plugin,  named [obs-gstreamer](https://github.com/fzwoch/obs-gstreamer), but this is not optimal, for anyone interested  here is the config 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17110707/151251336-a2d2318d-d741-4bc4-a8aa-2864938490d7.png)

Not closing, as the orginal issue persists

I've seen this before, It might be an avcodec (ffmpeg) issue where linux-v4l2.so is linked against. You could do the countercheck and change your GST pipeline to `v4lsrc ... ! queue ! avdec_mjpeg ! video.`. If libgstjpeg.so is linked against the same avcodec library, you should see the same issue. If so, it's not an OBS issue then.

> I've seen this before, It might be an avcodec (ffmpeg) issue where linux-v4l2.so is linked against. You could do the countercheck and change your GST pipeline to `v4lsrc ... ! queue ! avdec_mjpeg ! video.`. If libgstjpeg.so is linked against the same avcodec library, you should see the same issue. If so, it's not an OBS issue then.

I will definitely try later today. I'll get back with the results.

> I've seen this before, It might be an avcodec (ffmpeg) issue where linux-v4l2.so is linked against. You could do the countercheck and change your GST pipeline to `v4lsrc ... ! queue ! avdec_mjpeg ! video.`. If libgstjpeg.so is linked against the same avcodec library, you should see the same issue. If so, it's not an OBS issue then.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17110707/153292276-2dcc5f08-a1e1-4e36-af9e-d50aeaa171b6.png)

avdec_mjpeg produces that so

Heres a cool note, 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17110707/153679545-af755fc6-d789-409b-8136-e34081934ba0.png)
ffmpeg pulls up this for recording that camera
however other cameras which arent afected by this pull up 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17110707/153679619-4ea52091-f26e-4506-b79a-7c4ef2fec071.png)

```c
	case V4L2_PIX_FMT_MJPEG:
		return VIDEO_FORMAT_I422;
```
Looks like the plugin expects a hard coded 4:2:2 format as output format after MJPEG decoding, but this particular camera returns 4:2:0.

> ```c
> 
> 	case V4L2_PIX_FMT_MJPEG:
> 
> 		return VIDEO_FORMAT_I422;
> 
> ```
> 
> Looks like the plugin expects a hard coded 4:2:2 format as output format after MJPEG decoding, but this particular camera returns 4:2:0.
> 
> 

That makes sense looking at the logs I posted.

> Maybe something like this will help. I have no idea if that's the correct idea though.
> 
> 
> 
> ```diff
> 
> diff --git a/plugins/linux-v4l2/v4l2-mjpeg.c b/plugins/linux-v4l2/v4l2-mjpeg.c
> 
> index 45b2b9193..7b92d1053 100644
> 
> --- a/plugins/linux-v4l2/v4l2-mjpeg.c
> 
> +++ b/plugins/linux-v4l2/v4l2-mjpeg.c
> 
> @@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ int v4l2_init_mjpeg(struct v4l2_mjpeg_decoder *decoder)
> 
>         }
> 
>  
> 
>         decoder->context->flags2 |= AV_CODEC_FLAG2_FAST;
> 
> -       decoder->context->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ422P;
> 
> +       decoder->context->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
> 
>  
> 
>         if (avcodec_open2(decoder->context, decoder->codec, NULL) < 0) {
> 
>                 blog(LOG_ERROR, "failed to open codec");
> 
> @@ -94,5 +94,20 @@ int v4l2_decode_mjpeg(struct obs_source_frame *out, uint8_t *data,
> 
>                 out->linesize[i] = decoder->frame->linesize[i];
> 
>         }
> 
>  
> 
> +       switch (decoder->context->pix_fmt) {
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ422P:
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P:
> 
> +                       out->format = VIDEO_FORMAT_I422;
> 
> +                       break;
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ420P:
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV420P:
> 
> +                       out->format =  VIDEO_FORMAT_I420;
> 
> +                       break;
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P:
> 
> +               case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P:
> 
> +                       out->format =  VIDEO_FORMAT_I444;
> 
> +                       break;
> 
> +       }
> 
> +
> 
>         return 0;
> 
>  }
> 
> ```

I'm just test to see if this is indeed the issue, hard coding it to use i420, and the respective yuvj counterpart. And see what happens. ( I have little knowledge of c, but I know how to read so )

it is offical, that is the issue. hard coding it to I420 WORKS. HOLY LORD, WE HAVE AN ACTUAL ISSUE THAT WE CAN FIX. 2 lines changed boom ( this is changing I422, to I420 in both the  v4l2-helpers.h and v4l2-jpeg.c 

anyone who wants to see how i achieved this https://github.com/fbievan/obs-studio/commit/9163a1aef07cd34ae900d34b27b8e35430b17ec8.

So now we request for autodetection

rename.from: mjpeg codec glitching out on Linux
rename.to: 4:2:0 camera is being treated as 4:2:2 (No auto  detection)

rename.from: 4:2:0 camera is being treated as 4:2:2 (No auto  detection)
rename.to: 4:2:0 camera is being treated as 4:2:2 (No auto  detection) in Motion JPEG

issue.title: linux-v4l2: fixup mjpeg pixel format computation

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
<!--- Please fill out the following template, which will help other contributors review your Pull Request. -->

<!--- Make sure youve read the contribution guidelines here: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst -->

### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail. -->
<!--- If this change includes UI elements, please include screenshots. -->

Previously we assumed mjpeg was always decoded to 422 but it seems some
cameras provide different pixel formats such as 420.

This change delays setting the obs frame pixel format until after we
have decoded the v4l2 frame.

fixes #5821


### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open GitHub Issue, or implements feature request -->
<!--- from the Ideas page, please link to the issue here. -->

People prefer when their webcams render correctly.

### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment (hardware, OS version, etc.),-->
<!--- and the tests you ran, including how it may affect other areas of code. -->

My c920 with mjpeg remains unchanged. Hopefully the users from the issue can test this with their webcams.

### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your PR introduce? Uncomment all that apply -->
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
<!--- - New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) -->
<!--- - Tweak (non-breaking change to improve existing functionality) -->
<!--- - Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency) -->
<!--- - Code cleanup (non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable) -->
<!--- - Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) -->
<!--- - Documentation (a change to documentation pages) -->

### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.
